token_categories.description: Artificial Intelligence tokens that power AI/ML applications, data analysis, and intelligent automation systems.
Tokens that facilitate cross-chain interoperability and asset transfers between different blockchain networks.
Tokens related to digital comics, collectible comic assets, and comic-based NFT projects.
Decentralized Autonomous Organization tokens that grant governance rights and voting power in DAO structures.
Decentralized Exchange tokens that power automated market makers and trading platforms.
Tokens for platforms that aggregate liquidity from multiple DEXs to provide better trading rates.
Decentralized Finance tokens that power lending, borrowing, yield farming, and other DeFi protocols.
Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Network tokens that incentivize real-world infrastructure deployment.
Tokens for derivative trading platforms, options, futures, and synthetic asset protocols.
Tokens used in gambling platforms, casino games, and betting applications.
Tokens specifically for gaming platforms, in-game currencies, and gaming-related ecosystems.
Tokens representing baskets of other tokens, providing diversified exposure to multiple assets.
Tokens for platforms that help launch new projects, conduct IDOs, and provide incubation services.
Tokens for Layer 2 scaling solutions that improve blockchain throughput and reduce fees.
Tokens for lending and borrowing protocols, credit markets, and interest-bearing assets.
Meme tokens inspired by internet culture, jokes, and viral content, often with community-driven value.
Tokens for music platforms, artist royalties, and music-related NFT projects.
Non-Fungible Token platforms and marketplaces for digital collectibles and unique assets.
Tokens for platforms that facilitate NFT trading, minting, and marketplace operations.
Tokens for platforms that help create, design, and manage NFT projects.
Tokens for decentralized oracle networks that provide real-world data to smart contracts.
Tokens that don't fit into specific categories or have unique use cases.
Tokens for platforms that allow users to bet on real-world events and outcomes.
Tokens focused on privacy, anonymity, and secure transactions.
Real World Finance tokens that bridge traditional finance with blockchain technology.
Tokens that act as reserve assets or backing for other stablecoins and financial instruments.
Real World Asset tokens that represent ownership of physical assets on the blockchain.
Tokens for social media platforms, community governance, and social networking applications.
Alternative term for social tokens, focusing on social networking and community building.
Tokens pegged to stable assets like fiat currencies to minimize price volatility.
Tokens that track the price of real-world assets without direct ownership.
Tokens for synthetic asset protocols that create derivatives of real-world assets.
Utility tokens for blockchain tools, analytics platforms, and developer services.
Tokens for trading platforms, market makers, and trading-related services.
Tokens that provide access to specific services, products, or utilities within an ecosystem.
Tokens for wallet services, key management, and wallet-related utilities.
Tokens focused on yield farming, staking rewards, and passive income generation.
